org.lambda.util
Class LambdaCollections

java.lang.Object
  org.lambda.util.LambdaCollections

public class LambdaCollections
extends java.lang.Object

A collections utility that contains methods which through the use of the Lambda class provide the ability to run logic across collections with far less boilerplate code.

          Return true if all evaluations of lambda return true or not null when run across the elements within the provided collection/s

Method Detail

map

public static <R,E,RC extends java.util.Collection<R>,C extends java.util.Collection<E>> RC map(Lambda<R,E> lambda,
                                                                                                C... collections)
Run the logic within the lambda method across the provided collection/s that contain objects of type <E>. Then return a new collection containing the given return type <R>.

Type Parameters:
R - - the return type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the returned collection.
E - - the argument type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the given collection/s.
RC - - the type of the returned collection e.g. List, Set, Map... This does not have to be the same as the type of the given collection.
C - - the type of the given collection e.g. List, Set, Map...
Parameters:
lambda - - the Lambda object that contains the logic that will be run.
collections - - the collection/s that will have the logic run across each element.
Returns:
- a new collection containing the results of the lambda method.

map

public static <R,E,RC extends java.util.Collection<R>,C extends java.util.Collection<E>> RC map(java.lang.Class<RC> returnType,
                                                                                                Lambda<R,E> lambda,
                                                                                                C... collections)
Run the logic within the lambda method across the provided collection/s that contain objects of type <E>. Then return a new collection of the given type containing the given return type <R>.

Type Parameters:
R - - the return type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the returned collection.
E - - the argument type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the given collection/s.
RC - - the type of the returned collection e.g. List, Set, Map... This is set by the returnType argument.
C - - the type of the given collection e.g. List, Set, Map...
Parameters:
returnType - - the Class of the type of collections that should be returned e.g. List.class, Set.class, Map.class, ArrayList.class...
lambda - - the Lambda object that contains the logic that will be run.
collections - - the collection/s that will have the logic run across each element.
Returns:
- the new collection built from the given collections after the logic has been run over each element.

map

public static <R,E,RC extends java.util.Collection<R>,C extends java.util.Collection<E>> RC map(RC returnCollection,
                                                                                                Lambda<R,E> lambda,
                                                                                                C... collections)
Run the logic within the lambda method across the provided collection/s that contain objects of type <E>. Then place each processed element into the provided return collection of type .

Type Parameters:
R - - the return type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the returned collection.
E - - the argument type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the given collection/s.
RC - - the type of the returned collection e.g. List, Set, Map... This is set by the returnType argument.
C - - the type of the given collection e.g. List, Set, Map...
Parameters:
returnCollection - - the collection that will have the processed elements added to it.
lambda - - the Lambda object that contains the logic that will be run.
collections - - the collection/s that will have the logic run across each element.
Returns:
- the collection that was passed in as the returnCollection.

mapC

public static <E,C extends java.util.Collection<E>> void mapC(Lambda<java.lang.Object,E> lambda,
                                                              C collections)
Run the logic within the lambda method across the provided collection/s that contain objects of type <E>.

The return type for the Lambda class is set strictly to Object. This is because the return type in this method is irrelevant.

Type Parameters:
E - - the argument type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the given collection/s.
C - - the type of the given collection e.g. List, Set, Map...
Parameters:
lambda - - the Lambda object that contains the logic that will be run.
collections - - the collection/s that will have the logic run across each element.

mapCan

public static <R,E,RC extends java.util.Collection<R>,C extends java.util.Collection<java.util.Collection<E>>> RC mapCan(java.lang.Class<RC> returnType,
                                                                                                                         Lambda<R,E> lambda,
                                                                                                                         C... collections)
Run the logic within the lambda method across the provided collection/s that contain collections with objects of type <E>. Then return a collapsed single dimension collection of all the processed elements.

Type Parameters:
R - - the return type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the returned collection.
E - - the argument type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the given collections contains within the given collection/s.
RC - - the type of the returned collection e.g. List, Set, Map... This is set by the returnType argument.
C - - the type of the given collection e.g. List, Set, Map... lambda method.
Parameters:
returnType - - the Class of the type of collection that should be returned e.g. List.class, Set.class, Map.class...
lambda - - the Lambda object that contains the logic that will be run.
collections - - the 2 dimensional collection/s that will have the logic run across each element.
Returns:
- a single dimension collection containing the lambda results.

mapList

public static <R,E,RL extends java.util.List<R>,L extends java.util.List<E>> RL mapList(Lambda<R,L> lambda,
                                                                                        L... lists)
Run the logic within the lambda method across the provided list/s that contain objects of type <E>. The argument for the Lambda.lambda method when used with this method is a list containing the rest of the elements that are yet to be processed e,g. the current element/s that are yet to be process along with the remaining tail of the list/s. Then return a new list contain the result of the processed sub lists.

Type Parameters:
R - - the return type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the returned list.
E - - the argument type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the given list/s.
RL - - the type of the returned list e.g. ArrayList, LinkedList, Vector...
L - - The type of the list that will be passed into the lambda method as it's argument. This must be the same as the list that was passed in to be processed.
Parameters:
lambda - - the Lambda object that contains the logic that will be run.
lists - - the list/s that will have the logic run across each element.
Returns:
- a list containing all the results of the processed sub lists. This list will be the same length as the shortest processed list.

some

public static <R,E,C extends java.util.Collection<E>> java.lang.Boolean some(Lambda<R,E> lambda,
                                                                             C... collections)
Return true if any evaluation of lambda returns true or not null when run across the elements within the provided collection/s.

The lambda method will be iteratively evaluated until it returns a not null or true value where all evaluations will stop.

Type Parameters:
R - - the return type of the Lambda.lambda method.
E - - the argument type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the given collection/s.
C - - the type of the given collection e.g. List, Set, Map...
Parameters:
lambda - - the Lambda object that contains the logic that will be run.
collections - - the collection/s that will have the logic run across each element.
Returns:
- true if a non null or true value is returned from an evaluation of the lambda method otherwise false.

every

public static <R,E,C extends java.util.Collection<E>> java.lang.Boolean every(Lambda<R,E> lambda,
                                                                              C... collections)
Return true if all evaluations of lambda return true or not null when run across the elements within the provided collection/s

The lambda method will be iteratively evaluated until it returns a null or false value where all evaluations will stop.

Type Parameters:
R - - the return type of the Lambda.lambda method.
E - - the argument type of the Lambda.lambda method and the type contained with the given collection/s.
C - - the type of the given collection e.g. List, Set, Map...
Parameters:
lambda - - the Lambda object that contains the logic that will be run.
collections - - the collection/s that will have the logic run across each element.
Returns:
- true if a non null or true value is returned from all evaluations of the lambda method otherwise false.
